description:
Three sisters, Hozuki, Kazuki, and Hazuki, are descendants of Galileo and have completely different personalities and tastes; they never meet eye-to-eye. One day, the girls are suddenly attacked by a mysterious organization. The organization was after the "Galileo Tesoro" which Galileo Galilei was said to have discovered. Still unaware of what was going on, the sisters escape on the airship they built after the sudden attack. But it won't be so easy for these three sisters to help each other out in a pinch when they're constantly at odds with each other. What is the Tesoro, and what is the organization after? And what about the relationship between the sisters? It's a threesome of cute girls, action, and mystery!

(Source: Fuji Creative)

tags.name: Family Life

tags.name: Foreign

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

node.description:
[Blog](http://nailwonder.blog44.fc2.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/梅津泰臣) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuomi_Umetsu)

Best known for creating [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/), a cult classic film, and its sequels.

After graduating from university, Umetsu began his career at Tsuchida Production, and later switched to Toei Animation, where he became particularly influenced by [Masami Suda](https://anilist.co/staff/115737/) of [Hokuto no Ken](https://anilist.co/anime/967/) fame.

In 1998, the adult animation [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/) gained a lot of support not only in Japan but also in Hollywood. In 1999, he worked on Castlevania 64 and made the character illustrations for the game. Umetsu released [Mezzo Forte](https://anilist.co/anime/221/) in 2000, [Mezzo](https://anilist.co/anime/222/) in 2004 and [Kite Liberator](https://anilist.co/anime/3323/) in 2008. In 2009, Umetsu had several projects on his hands, most notably an anime film titled [Kiss and Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/101704/). The film took nearly five years to complete.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).
Members: Erina (エリナ) (vocals) Ommy (オミー) (guitar) JUN TAKAI (高井淳) (bass)
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/damnedrive) | [pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/61654440)

Niθ, previously known as Nin Niθ(仁Niθ), started his carreer at the Eroge company Nitroplus. For his first big job, he was lent to the game company âge, where he drew some mecha designs for their game Muv-Luv. In the same year he became lead graphical designer for Nitroplus' game, Zanma Taisei Demonbane. He also illustrated the six-part book series with the same name. Afterwards he worked on Jingai Makyou (2005) and Kishin Hishou Demonbane (2006). His last game at Nitroplus was Zoku Satsuriku no Django. 

2007/8 Nitroplus cooperated with the animation studio Gonzo for the anime series Blassreiter where Niθ was responsible for the original character design.

After this he left Nitroplus and worked freelance as an illustrator for several different projects including a number of ongoing light novel series.

[Blog](http://nailwonder.blog44.fc2.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/梅津泰臣) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuomi_Umetsu)

Best known for creating [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/), a cult classic film, and its sequels.

After graduating from university, Umetsu began his career at Tsuchida Production, and later switched to Toei Animation, where he became particularly influenced by [Masami Suda](https://anilist.co/staff/115737/) of [Hokuto no Ken](https://anilist.co/anime/967/) fame.

In 1998, the adult animation [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/) gained a lot of support not only in Japan but also in Hollywood. In 1999, he worked on Castlevania 64 and made the character illustrations for the game. Umetsu released [Mezzo Forte](https://anilist.co/anime/221/) in 2000, [Mezzo](https://anilist.co/anime/222/) in 2004 and [Kite Liberator](https://anilist.co/anime/3323/) in 2008. In 2009, Umetsu had several projects on his hands, most notably an anime film titled [Kiss and Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/101704/). The film took nearly five years to complete.

Website Biography Negoto was a Japanese electronic rock band from Chiba Prefecture. Negoto formed in 2007 when the members were high school students. In 2008, the band won a special jury prize at the 1st Senkō riot (閃光ライオット),which is a music festival that features teen bands in Japan.The band debuted in 2010. They are best known for the 2010 hit song "Loop" reached number 3 in Billboard Japan Hot 100, the 2011 hit song "Charon" reached number 6 in Billboard Japan Hot 100 and the 2012 hit song "sharp ♯" (from the anime series Mobile Suit Gundam AGE) reached number 11 in Billboard Japan Hot 100. The band's other anime theme contributions include Galilei Donna, Shimajirou to Kujira no Uta, and Destiny (from Gintama°). Disbandment On December 28, 2018, Negoto published a message on their official website stating that they would disband on July 20, 2019. They embarked on their last tour on May 28 and which came to an end on July 20. Former Members - [Sachiko Aoyama](https://anilist.co/staff/148614) (蒼山幸子) – vocals, keyboards - [Mizuki Masuda](https://anilist.co/staff/148611) (沙田瑞紀) – guitar - Yū Fujisaki (藤咲佑) – bass guitar - Sayako Sawamura (澤村小夜子) – drums (Source: en.wikipedia.org)
Director of the Finishing Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118328356)

Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures), he is now affiliated with [CygamesPictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._
